item.title: Talk: Continuous-discrete smoothing of diffusions
item.description: Presentation in the Mannheim Probability and Statistics Seminar. University of Mannheim. Wednesday, 2018-05-09, 12.15-13.00, room A5 C116. Abstract Suppose X is a multidimensional diffusion taking values in ℝᵈ with drift b and dispersion coefficient σ, satisfying the stochastic differential equation (SDE) dXₜ = b(t,Xₜ) dt + σ(t,Xₜ) dWₜ. (1) The process W is a vector valued process consisting of independent Brownian motions. We assume the process is incompletely observed at times tᵢ and the n observations are given by
